items.name: Arrowhame
items.description: Tiny, dried leaves of a climbing plant. Rehydrated and applied as a paste to diseased flesh, grants a Save Versus Doom against a disease of magical origin. If the save succeeds, the disease recedes within 1d3 days. Repeat applications of Arrowhame are ineffective.

consumption_effect.description: Grants Save vs Doom against magical disease; if successful, disease recedes in 1d3 days
consumption_effect.condition: applied as paste to diseased flesh

items.name: Blood Canker
items.description: Rust-red dried residue of a slime-mould prevalent in Mulchgrove. Mixed with alcohol and drunk, cures 1d3 Hit Points. Each usage of Blood Canker has a 2-in-6 chance of permanently reducing the character's Constitution by 1.

consumption_effect.description: Heals 1d3 HP but 2-in-6 chance of permanent -1 CON

items.name: Bosun's Balm
items.description: Roots dredged up from a rare river weed. Eaten at breakfast, the herb stimulates the body's energies, bringing on great endurance for one day. For encumbrance purposes, the effective weight of the character's armour is reduced by 50% or by one bulk category.

consumption_effect.description: Armour weight reduced by 50% or one bulk category for one day

items.name: Fenob
items.description: The root-bulbs of a forest flower. A bulb of Fenob placed under the tongue before bed causes the character to recover extra 1 Hit Point if a good night's rest is had.

consumption_effect.description: Recover extra 1 HP with good night's rest

items.name: Gillywort
items.description: A finely ground, white powder derived from the leaves of a creeper that favours dank cave-mouths. When the powder is added to liquid, there is a 3-in-6 chance that it turns a shocking purple in the presence of poison. A dose of Gillywort is enough to test one liquid.

consumption_effect.description: 3-in-6 chance to detect poison in liquid (turns purple)

items.name: Grue's Ear
items.description: Rubbery, pink ear fungus. Consuming a specimen brings on a mild psychedelia wherein the character's vision is tinged pink and they become sensitive to bright light. The character's alertness is also enhanced, granting a 3-in-6 chance of being able to act during a Surprise Round when their party is surprised. These effects last for 2d6 Turns.

consumption_effect.description: Vision tinged pink, light sensitive, 3-in-6 chance to act in surprise rounds

items.name: Hogscap
items.description: Mottled, fist-sized puffballs, harvested in their plump, immature stage. Consumption brings on a woozy state of mild psychedelia, with wobbling vision and hallucinations of distant wails and keening. The character suffers a –1 penalty to Attack Rolls but gains the ability to sense magical influence in any object touched for 1 Turn. The effects last for 1d6 hours.

consumption_effect.description: Sense magic in touched objects for 1 Turn; -1 Attack penalty; effects last 1d6 hours

items.name: Lankswith
items.description: Powdered root of a floating pond weed. Taken as a tea with supper, cures common ailments overnight.

consumption_effect.description: Cures common ailments overnight

items.name: Lilywhite
items.description: Carefully dried and folded petals of a marsh lily. Smoking the petals in a pipe brings on a deep, soporific state that aids sleep in harsh conditions. Smoked before bed, the character gains a +1 bonus to any Constitution Checks required to rest.

consumption_effect.description: +1 bonus to Constitution Checks for resting

items.name: Marshwick
items.description: The seeds of a scarce and unremarkable marsh flower, ground into a blue powder. A character afflicted by a poison of animal origin who drinks a dose of Marshwick with a swig of wine may Save Versus Doom. If the save succeeds, the venom is neutralised. Repeat doses are ineffective.

consumption_effect.description: Save vs Doom to neutralise animal venom; repeat doses ineffective

items.name: Moonhaw
items.description: Pale white berries of a thorny bush, only harvested at night under the light of the moon. 1 Turn after chewing a handful of the berries, the character gains the ability to see normally up to 10′ in utter blackness. The effects are short-lived, only lasting for 3 Turns.

consumption_effect.description: See normally up to 10' in utter darkness for 3 Turns

items.name: Ofteritch
items.description: A black liquid fermented from the young roots of the lantern elm. A character afflicted by a poison of plant origin who drinks a dose of Ofteritch may Save Versus Doom. If the save succeeds, the poison is neutralised. Repeat doses are ineffective.

consumption_effect.description: Save vs Doom to neutralise plant poison; repeat doses ineffective

items.name: Sallow Parsley
items.description: Silvery-leafed young shoots of a rare fern, which look uncannily like the culinary herb parsley. On a day spent resting in safety, a character who drinks an infusion of this herb throughout the day will recover 2 Hit Points, in addition to the normal healing due to rest.

consumption_effect.description: Recover extra 2 HP when resting safely for a day
consumption_effect.condition: drunk as infusion throughout day of rest

items.name: Smottlebread
items.description: Spongy, green, bread-like hunks of giant mushroom flesh. Consuming a chunk of Smottlebread causes a trance state lasting 1d6 Turns, during which the character enters into communion with the spirit of the Smottlebread. Following the trance, the character's vision is tinged green and their coordination is fuddled (–1 penalty to melee Attack Rolls, –2 penalty to missile Attack Rolls). Contact with the fungal spirit steels the character's mind, granting them a +2 bonus to Saving Throws against effects of magical origin. Post-trance effects last for 1d6 Turns.

consumption_effect.description: +2 to saves vs magic; -1 melee/-2 missile attack penalties; 1d6 Turn trance then 1d6 Turn effects

items.name: Spirithame
items.description: Delicate, curled leaves of a rare moss. When crushed and applied to wounds, cures 1d2 Hit Points. Spirithame loses its effectiveness quickly—a character only benefits from one dose per day.

consumption_effect.description: Heals 1d2 HP when applied to wounds; one dose per day limit

items.name: Tom-a-Merry
items.description: Tiny, cute mushrooms as tall as a baby's finger, with pointy blue caps. Consuming a dose of Tom-a-Merry induces a hallucinatory state where time lurches and becomes distorted. The character suffers a –2 penalty to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws and, in combat, always acts last in the Round. The character also gains the ability to see invisible objects and creatures. The effects last for 1d6 Turns.

consumption_effect.description: See invisible creatures/objects; -2 Attack/Saves, always act last; 1d6 Turns

items.name: Wallowmost
items.description: Fluffy yellow buds of a spring plant that flowers in Mulchgrove. A character afflicted by a poison of fungal origin who chews and swallows a dose of Wallowmost may Save Versus Doom. If the save succeeds, the poison is neutralised. Repeat doses are ineffective.

consumption_effect.description: Save vs Doom to neutralise fungal poison; repeat doses ineffective

items.name: Wayfarrow
items.description: Desiccated red berries of a thorny bush. Chewing the berries throughout the day brings on great vigour and stamina when marching. If the character engages in a forced march, they have a 3-in-6 chance of being fit for action the following day, without the usual penalties for not resting.

consumption_effect.description: 3-in-6 chance to avoid forced march penalties next day
consumption_effect.condition: chewed throughout day during forced march

items.name: Witch's Oyster
items.description: Miniature, bright violet oyster mushrooms that grow in high tree branches. Boiling a portion and drinking the water induces a visionary trance lasting 1d4 hours. Upon awakening, the character gains an oracular insight into a topic that puzzles them. The Referee should describe the insight to the player, determining its accuracy by rolling 1d6: 1–2: the insight is entirely apposite and truthful, 3–4: the insight hints at the truth in a mysterious manner, 5–6: the insight is entirely misleading.

consumption_effect.description: Visionary trance (1d4 hours) grants oracular insight; accuracy varies (1d6: 1-2 true, 3-4 hints, 5-6 misleading)

items.name: Wolfsbane
items.description: Long sprigs of purple flowers. Werewolves find Wolfsbane repulsive, but the bloom is odourless to others. A werewolf must make a successful Save Versus Doom each Round in order to make a melee attack against someone decorated with sprigs of Wolfsbane.
items.smell: Odourless to non-werewolves, repulsive to werewolves

consumption_effect.description: Werewolves must Save vs Doom each round to melee attack wearer
